intro: Randia jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine-flowered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that emit a sweet scent. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia jasminiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
